name: W. E. Knight and K. K. Knight, Appellants, v. G. W. Atkinson, as Receiver of the Bank of Hastings, a corporation, Appellee

judges: Terrell, C. J., and Whitfield and Buford, J. J., concur.
parties: W. E. Knight and K. K. Knight, Appellants, v. G. W. Atkinson, as Receiver of the Bank of Hastings, a corporation, Appellee.

opinions.text:
Per Curiam.
This cause having heretofore been submitted to the Court upon the transcript of the record of the Decree herein, and briefs and argument, of counsel for the respective parties, and the record having been seen and inspected, and the Court being now advised of its judgment to be given in the premises, it seems to the Court that there is no error in the said Decree; it is, therefore, considered, ordered and adjudged by the Court that the said Decree of the circuit court be, and the same is hereby affirmed.
Terrell, C. J., and Whitfield and Buford, J. J., concur.
opinions.author: Per Curiam.

attorneys: MacWilliams & Perry and M. L. Stephens, for Appellee.
casebody.head_matter:
W. E. Knight and K. K. Knight, Appellants, v. G. W. Atkinson, as Receiver of the Bank of Hastings, a corporation, Appellee.
Special Division A.
Decision filed July 28, 1930.
Judgment reaffirmed February 26, 1931.
J ones <& Green, for Appellants;
MacWilliams & Perry and M. L. Stephens, for Appellee.
